cv.description: Fills a connected component with the given color.

pars.description: – Input/output 1- or 3-channel, 8-bit, or floating-point image. It is modified by the function unless the FLOODFILL_MASK_ONLY flag is set in the second variant of the function. See the details below.
pars.name: image

pars.description:
–

(For the second function only) Operation mask that should be a single-channel 8-bit image, 2 pixels wider and 2 pixels taller. The function uses and updates the mask, so you take responsibility of initializing the mask content. Flood-filling cannot go across non-zero pixels in the mask. For example, an edge detector output can be used as a mask to stop filling at edges. It is possible to use the same mask in multiple calls to the function to make sure the filled area does not overlap.

Note

Since the mask is larger than the filled image, a pixel in image corresponds to the pixel in the mask .
pars.name: mask

pars.description: – Starting point.
pars.name: seedPoint

pars.description: – New value of the repainted domain pixels.
pars.name: newVal

pars.description: – Optional output parameter set by the function to the minimum bounding rectangle of the repainted domain.
pars.name: rect

pars.description: – Maximal lower brightness/color difference between the currently observed pixel and one of its neighbors belonging to the component, or a seed pixel being added to the component.
pars.name: loDiff

pars.description: – Maximal upper brightness/color difference between the currently observed pixel and one of its neighbors belonging to the component, or a seed pixel being added to the component.
pars.name: upDiff

pars.description:
–

Operation flags. Lower bits contain a connectivity value, 4 (default) or 8, used within the function. Connectivity determines which neighbors of a pixel are considered. Upper bits can be 0 or a combination of the following flags:

  • FLOODFILL_FIXED_RANGE If set, the difference between the current pixel and seed pixel is considered. Otherwise, the difference between neighbor pixels is considered (that is, the range is floating).
pars.name: flags

cv.name: int floodFill(InputOutputArray image, InputOutputArray mask, Point seedPoint, Scalar newVal, Rect* rect, Scalar loDiff, Scalar upDiff, int flags)

cv.description: Converts an image from one color space to another.

pars.description: – input image: 8-bit unsigned, 16-bit unsigned ( CV_16UC... ), or single-precision floating-point.
pars.name: src

pars.description: – output image of the same size and depth as src.
pars.name: dst

pars.description: – color space conversion code (see the description below).
pars.name: code

pars.description: – number of channels in the destination image; if the parameter is 0, the number of the channels is derived automatically from src and code .
pars.name: dstCn

cv.name: void cvtColor(InputArray src, OutputArray dst, int code, int dstCn)

cv.description: Calculates the integral of an image.

pars.description: – integral image as , 32-bit integer or floating-point (32f or 64f).
pars.name: sum

pars.description: – integral image for squared pixel values; it is , double-precision floating-point (64f) array.
pars.name: sqsum

pars.description: – integral for the image rotated by 45 degrees; it is array with the same data type as sum.
pars.name: tilted

pars.description: – desired depth of the integral and the tilted integral images, CV_32S, CV_32F, or CV_64F.
pars.name: sdepth

cv.name: void integral(InputArray src, OutputArray sum, OutputArray sqsum, OutputArray tilted, int sdepth)

cv.description: Applies a fixed-level threshold to each array element.

pars.description: – input array (single-channel, 8-bit or 32-bit floating point).
pars.name: src

pars.description: – output array of the same size and type as src.
pars.name: dst

pars.description: – threshold value.
pars.name: thresh

pars.description: – maximum value to use with the THRESH_BINARY and THRESH_BINARY_INV thresholding types.
pars.name: maxval

pars.description: – thresholding type (see the details below).
pars.name: type

cv.name: double threshold(InputArray src, OutputArray dst, double thresh, double maxval, int type)

cv.description: Performs a marker-based image segmentation using the watershed algorithm.

pars.description: – Input 8-bit 3-channel image.
pars.name: image

pars.description: – Input/output 32-bit single-channel image (map) of markers. It should have the same size as image .
pars.name: markers

cv.name: void watershed(InputArray image, InputOutputArray markers)

pars.description: – Input 8-bit 3-channel image.
pars.name: img

pars.description:
–

Input/output 8-bit single-channel mask. The mask is initialized by the function when mode is set to GC_INIT_WITH_RECT. Its elements may have one of following values:

  • GC_BGD defines an obvious background pixels.
pars.name: mask

pars.description: – ROI containing a segmented object. The pixels outside of the ROI are marked as “obvious background”. The parameter is only used when mode==GC_INIT_WITH_RECT .
pars.name: rect

pars.description: – Temporary array for the background model. Do not modify it while you are processing the same image.
pars.name: bgdModel

pars.description: – Temporary arrays for the foreground model. Do not modify it while you are processing the same image.
pars.name: fgdModel

pars.description: – Number of iterations the algorithm should make before returning the result. Note that the result can be refined with further calls with mode==GC_INIT_WITH_MASK or mode==GC_EVAL .
pars.name: iterCount

pars.description:
–

Operation mode that could be one of the following:

  • GC_INIT_WITH_RECT The function initializes the state and the mask using the provided rectangle. After that it runs iterCount iterations of the algorithm.
pars.name: mode

cv.name: void grabCut(InputArray img, InputOutputArray mask, Rect rect, InputOutputArray bgdModel, InputOutputArray fgdModel, int iterCount, int mode)

cv.description: Calculates the integral of an image.

pars.description: – integral image as , 32-bit integer or floating-point (32f or 64f).
pars.name: sum

pars.description: – integral image for squared pixel values; it is , double-precision floating-point (64f) array.
pars.name: sqsum

pars.description: – desired depth of the integral and the tilted integral images, CV_32S, CV_32F, or CV_64F.
pars.name: sdepth

cv.name: void integral(InputArray src, OutputArray sum, OutputArray sqsum, int sdepth)

cv.description: Calculates the distance to the closest zero pixel for each pixel of the source image.

pars.description: – 8-bit, single-channel (binary) source image.
pars.name: src

pars.description: – Output image with calculated distances. It is a 32-bit floating-point, single-channel image of the same size as src .
pars.name: dst

pars.description: – Type of distance. It can be CV_DIST_L1, CV_DIST_L2 , or CV_DIST_C .
pars.name: distanceType

pars.description: – Size of the distance transform mask. It can be 3, 5, or CV_DIST_MASK_PRECISE (the latter option is only supported by the first function). In case of the CV_DIST_L1 or CV_DIST_C distance type, the parameter is forced to 3 because a mask gives the same result as or any larger aperture.
pars.name: maskSize

cv.name: void distanceTransform(InputArray src, OutputArray dst, int distanceType, int maskSize)

cv.description: Applies an adaptive threshold to an array.

pars.description: – Source 8-bit single-channel image.
pars.name: src

pars.description: – Destination image of the same size and the same type as src .
pars.name: dst

pars.description: – Non-zero value assigned to the pixels for which the condition is satisfied. See the details below.
pars.name: maxValue

pars.description: – Adaptive thresholding algorithm to use, ADAPTIVE_THRESH_MEAN_C or ADAPTIVE_THRESH_GAUSSIAN_C . See the details below.
pars.name: adaptiveMethod

pars.description: – Thresholding type that must be either THRESH_BINARY or THRESH_BINARY_INV .
pars.name: thresholdType

pars.description: – Size of a pixel neighborhood that is used to calculate a threshold value for the pixel: 3, 5, 7, and so on.
pars.name: blockSize

pars.description: – Constant subtracted from the mean or weighted mean (see the details below). Normally, it is positive but may be zero or negative as well.
pars.name: C

cv.name: void adaptiveThreshold(InputArray src, OutputArray dst, double maxValue, int adaptiveMethod, int thresholdType, int blockSize, double C)

cv.description: Calculates the distance to the closest zero pixel for each pixel of the source image.

pars.description: – 8-bit, single-channel (binary) source image.
pars.name: src

pars.description: – Output image with calculated distances. It is a 32-bit floating-point, single-channel image of the same size as src .
pars.name: dst

pars.description: – Optional output 2D array of labels (the discrete Voronoi diagram). It has the type CV_32SC1 and the same size as src . See the details below.
pars.name: labels

pars.description: – Type of distance. It can be CV_DIST_L1, CV_DIST_L2 , or CV_DIST_C .
pars.name: distanceType

pars.description: – Size of the distance transform mask. It can be 3, 5, or CV_DIST_MASK_PRECISE (the latter option is only supported by the first function). In case of the CV_DIST_L1 or CV_DIST_C distance type, the parameter is forced to 3 because a mask gives the same result as or any larger aperture.
pars.name: maskSize

pars.description: – Type of the label array to build. If labelType==DIST_LABEL_CCOMP then each connected component of zeros in src (as well as all the non-zero pixels closest to the connected component) will be assigned the same label. If labelType==DIST_LABEL_PIXEL then each zero pixel (and all the non-zero pixels closest to it) gets its own label.
pars.name: labelType

cv.name: void distanceTransform(InputArray src, OutputArray dst, OutputArray labels, int distanceType, int maskSize, int labelType)

cv.description: Calculates the integral of an image.

pars.description: – integral image as , 32-bit integer or floating-point (32f or 64f).
pars.name: sum

pars.description: – desired depth of the integral and the tilted integral images, CV_32S, CV_32F, or CV_64F.
pars.name: sdepth

cv.name: void integral(InputArray src, OutputArray sum, int sdepth)
